climbs.name: Tiny Dancer
climbs.fa: P1: bolted by Kira Engle June 2018, FFA:  Kevin Macartney & Kira Engle, June 2018; P2: bolted by Mike Engle, June 2018

content.description: At the base of the big wall of Stone Temple, currently the farthest left route on the lower face.
content.protection: Bolts, chain anchors at the top

content.description:
First pitch - 5.10+  follow the line of bolts up the face to the gray face and anchors above. Climbing is very sequential and strenuous for the grade.

Second pitch - 5.10 climb the crack above to chain anchors

OR : 5.11 climb the face just left of the crack/crevice above the first pitch.
content.protection:
1/2" bolt/hangers with 3/8" chain anchors at top of 1st and 2nd pitches

first pitch - 13 bolts?

second pitch - 10 bolts ?
content.location: Located on the north side of Stone Temple just right of the large cleft at the base.

climbs.name: Riders On The Storm
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, & Vernon Phinney; June 2018

content.description: Start on a narrow grassy ledge with a belay bolt.  Move up to a shallow overlap on grey rock.  Make thin undercling/side pull moves until gaining some good chert holds about a third the way up the climb.  Follow good but widely spaced chert holds up and right to a very thin section of grey rocks.  Continue up on micro runnels and shallow finger pockets to a slabby thin move to gain the anchors which are just below a ledge on the top of a broad pillar..
content.protection: 12- 14 bolts, sport anchors.  Lower with a single 60 meter rope back to the narrow grassy ledge.
content.location: Follow a ledge system at the right side base of Dark Side of the Moon.  Continue on the ledge to stance and a belay bolt below a broad pillar like formation on the left side of Stone Temple.  The belay bolt has a name tag on it.

climbs.name: Perdida
climbs.fa: FA: Eric Bluemn; Bolted by: Skyler Stotts & Vernon Phinney. May 2020

content.description:
Perdida 5.12-/5.11+ 2 pitches – 160 feet. First pitch (80 feet) 5.12-, 14 bolts to chain anchors at top of flake. Difficult moves off the ground lead to a series of cruxes requiring a wide variety of climbing techniques. Second pitch (80 feet) 5.11+ 14 bolts to chain anchors (fifty feet below actual summit). Ascend the white/grey face following the line of bolts up a right-trending line of chert, then follow a crack system (climbing left and right of the bolt line as needed) up the right shoulder of the Stone Temple.

This is an amazing line and you should find it challenging and interesting from top to bottom!
content.protection: 1/2" Bolt/Hangers with 3/8" chain anchors at mid point and top.
content.location: .Route starts 15 feet to left of large hole in face on the north side of Stone Temple.

climbs.name: Papa Was a Rolling Stone
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney & Chris Barnes, May 2018

content.description: Excellent climbing up a face with chert features. The climbing is consistent at 5.10.
content.protection: 1/2" bolts,, anchors at top and middle - 1/2" x 4 3/4" bolts with chain anchors. 60 m rope will get you off.
content.location: Route starts just right of Creep and goes directly up the face, and is left of The Art of Letting Go.

climbs.name: Hold On Loosely But Don't Let Go
climbs.fa: bolted by Chris Barnes, Mike Engle & Vernon Phinney, July 2018

content.description: Climb directly above the 1st pitch anchors of "The Art of Letting Go".  Follow a right trending line on thin grey limestone and some chert holds to the top anchors of "The Art of Letting Go".
content.protection: 12 bolts. Sport anchors.  With a 60 meter rope, lower back to the ledge and 1st ptich chain anchors of "The Art of Letting Go".  Rappel back to the ground with a single 60 meter rope.
content.location: This is a single pitch variation to the second pitch of "The Art of Letting Go".

climbs.name: Creep
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney & Chris Barnes, May 2018

content.description: The left-most route on Stone Temple goes up just to the right of the prominent black streak that separates Dark Side of the Moon from Stone Temple.  It is approximately 100 feet of excellent climbing on solid limestone and chert.
content.protection: 1/2" bolts with sport anchors at the top.  70 meter rope required to rappel or lower.
content.location: The first route on the right of the black streak on the south side of Stone Temple.

climbs.name: The Art of Letting Go
climbs.fa: bolted by Vernon Phinney & Chris Barnes, May 2018

content.description:
P1:  5.7 climb up and right to a left facing dihedral and stem up to a nice ledge and the mid-point chain anchors 75ft.

P2:  5.9  start up  and left of the mid-point anchors (straight up and trending slightly right is "Hold On Loosely But Don't Let Go").  Climb the weaknesses to the top anchors - 90 ft. The second pitch is outstanding climbing for 5.9 - steep with holds and protection where you want them!
content.protection:
1/2" bolts. mid-point and top 3/8" chain anchors.

9 bolts on first pitch. 11 bolts on second pitch.

2 rappels and one 60 meter rope to descend.
content.location: Starts at the left facing dihedral of the block face attached to Stone Temple.
